channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Urban clearway signs place with no infromation, 11th October
item.description:
These urban clearway signs have been outside 10 & 12 Farleigh Avenue with no contact from who left them. Has the council placed them? If not could they be removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farleigh Avenue, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin Bags Full of Rendering and Rubble, 11th October
item.description:
Some renovation work took place on a house on the 26th June ‘25 and on each occasion the workmen cleared their stone and render and placed the rubble outside of the house along the alley way. The owner of the house where the rubble originated from should have arranged for the rubble to removed by the workmen or arranged for a skip to take it away. Instead the workmen / property owner has just left it strewn alongside the alleyway opposite their back garden gate. If we all took this approach then there would be no access or alleyway for the locals and it would be a serious hazard to animals elderly and kids. I’ve given them 3 months to clear it and the bags of render and rubble remain strewn across the either side of the alley way. It needs to be reported and removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Longmeadow Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On the road in front of the Regents Park Barracks Bus Stop. On the left hand side of the road i.e. heading south., 11th October
item.description:
This manhole clanks extremely loudly every time a car goes over it. It is driving us insane. We first notified Camden on 09th July 2025 and the problem has not been rectified. What on earth do we have to do to get this problem fixed? Do I have to write to our local MP? Seriously, can someone please call me to get this fixed. It is affecting our mental health.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 197, Albany Street, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned cat, 11th October
